msContents.summary: Receipt for payment of 400 drachmae by a wine merchant.

msItemStruct.note: Text is on one side only, 10 lines written with the fibers. Left, top, and bottom margins appear largely intact. Text mentions the village of Euhemeria.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 7.5 x 12.9cm. Torn along right margin. Vertical tears/holes in the middle of the document.

origin.persName: Caesar Marcus Antonius Gordianus Pius Felix Augustus

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1898-9) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: The third year of the Emperor Caesar Marcus Antonius Gordianus Pius Felix Augustus, Epeiph 14. Paid over to the account of Antonius Philoxenus through Aurelius Nemesianus, agent, by Chrysas, wine-merchant of the village Euhemeria, on account of the payment for wine of the produce of the second year, four hundred drachmae of silver, total 400 dr. (Grenfell, Hunt & Hogarth)

listBibl.bibl: P. Fay. 63 John R. Abercrombie, "The University Museum's Collection of Papyri and Related Materials," Expedition 20.2 (Winter 1978): 32-37.
